title: AI Governance Coordinator (Policy + Ops)
summary: Helps teams use AI safely by setting guardrails, documenting policies, reviewing risks, and keeping usage compliant and auditable.
whyFutureReady: As AI adoption increases, organizations need accountability, documentation, and audit trails.
This role sits at the intersection of people, process, and risk—hard to fully automate responsibly.

items: Create practical AI usage guidelines by team/use case.
Maintain an approved-tools list and escalation rules.
Define what data can/can’t be used with which tools.
Assess copyright/IP, privacy, and security risks.
Provide templates (SOPs, checklists) for common AI tasks.
Monitor adoption and update policies as tools change.

proofProjects.title: AI use-case approval checklist
whatYouBuild: A rubric/checklist to approve or reject AI use cases

proofProjects.title: Approved-tools playbook
whatYouBuild: Tool matrix: allowed data types + best practices

starterPlan30Days: Write a 1-page AI usage policy for a small team (practical, not legalese).
Create a checklist for safe input data handling.
Run one training session and capture FAQs.
